alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 25 at 4:29AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following county, Anderson. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palestine, Elkhart, Frankston, Montalba, Brushy Creek, Johnson, Pert, Cedar Creek, Crystal Lake, Tucker, Neches, Bois D`arc, Tennessee Colony, Todd City, Bradford, Massey Lake, Broom City, Blackfoot, Springfield and Slocum.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
